intro: Psoralea scaposa, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous traits and often compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees. Psoralea scaposa is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
